report.title: Deallocated squares list 2
report.description: List information about squares that have been deallocated.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM locations square LEFT JOIN locations_websites lw on lw.location_id=square.id AND lw.deleted=false LEFT JOIN location_attribute_values lavEx on lavEx.location_id=square.id AND lavEx.location_attribute_id=#excluded_square_attr_id# AND lavEx.deleted=false --We are not interested in squares which were de-allocated without any data being created LEFT JOIN locations plot on plot.parent_id=square.id AND plot.deleted=false LEFT JOIN samples s on s.location_id=plot.id AND s.deleted=false AND s.training=false --If square is de-allocated it must have a deleted allocation JOIN person_attribute_values pavRemovedAlloc on pavRemovedAlloc.int_value=square.id AND pavRemovedAlloc.person_attribute_id=#user_square_attr_id# AND pavRemovedAlloc.deleted=true AND (EXTRACT(epoch from age(pavRemovedAlloc.updated_on::DATE, pavRemovedAlloc.created_on::DATE)) / 86400)::int >= #min_time_between_alloc_and_dealloc# JOIN people p on p.id=pavRemovedAlloc.person_id AND p.deleted=false JOIN users u on u.person_id=p.id AND u.deleted=false JOIN users_websites uw on u.id=uw.user_id AND uw.website_id=lw.website_id AND uw.created_on >= CAST(COALESCE('#ignore_registration_dates_before#','1500-01-01') as date) LEFT JOIN users_websites uwac on u.id=uwac.user_id AND uwac.site_role_id IS NOT NULL LEFT JOIN users_websites accesscheck on accesscheck.website_id=uwac.website_id AND accesscheck.user_id=#auth_user_id# AND accesscheck.site_role_id<3 WHERE (square.location_type_id=#core_square_type_id#) AND #website_filter# AND (lavEx.int_value != 1 OR lavEx.int_value IS NULL) AND square.deleted=false AND --If a square is deallocated, then check it hasn't been re-allocated square.id NOT in (select pavAlloc.int_value from person_attribute_values pavAlloc where pavAlloc.int_value=square.id AND pavAlloc.person_attribute_id=#user_square_attr_id# AND pavAlloc.deleted=false ) --To get the most revent owner information, we need to make sure we are only getting the most recent de-allocation AND pavRemovedAlloc.id in (select max(pavMostRecentRemovedAlloc.id) from person_attribute_values pavMostRecentRemovedAlloc where pavMostRecentRemovedAlloc.int_value=square.id AND pavMostRecentRemovedAlloc.deleted=true) AND (#created_data_only#=0 OR (#created_data_only#=1 AND s.id IS NOT NULL))

param.name: user_square_attr_id
param.display: Id of the person attribute that holds user squares

param.name: ignore_registration_dates_before
param.description: Ignore anyone who registered earlier than this date where working out if a square has been allocated or not.

param.name: ignore_square_dates_before
param.description: Ignore any squares created before this date. Useful if old squares are left on the system but are not currently active.

param.name: excluded_square_attr_id
param.description: Id of attribute that holds whether a square is excluded or not. If it is excluded then don't display on the map.

param.name: created_data_only
param.display: Only include squares that have had data (samples) created for them

param.name: min_time_between_alloc_and_dealloc
param.description: Minimum time (in days) between when the square was allocated and deallocated, this allows squares which were allocated and deallocated immeditaely (e.g. due to a mistake) to be ignored.

column.name: email
column.sql: CASE WHEN accesscheck.id IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE p.email_address END
